intro: Adinandra kamalae, commonly known as the Kona mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. Adinandra kamalae plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
